abstract.para: This page contains old version of mod-xslt snapshots and releases.

release.update: A few bug fixes, and updated documentation. New parameter to disable the mod-xslt copyright notice at run time, but nothing major in this snapshot.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: configure, configure.ac - updated automatically by release scripts, in order to prepare a snapshot.

release.update: A lot of bugs corrected. Lot of pending patches have been submitted. Should work much more smoothly on non-linux systems, with better local:// handling, debugging options, and support for apache 2.x, not just 2.0. This snapshot is meant to be short lived: more changes to come in the next few days.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: tools/snapshot - some recent changes.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: tools/library/get-versions - works with recent version of autoconf and the configure files.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: tools/data/tla.changelog - split in two files. Fairly pointless, but needed to simplify the snapshot above.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: tools/data/tla.descripiton - same as above.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: utils/Makefile.in - modified sed regular expression to work with recent versions of autoconf, which seem to add a |#.*#| to variable values.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache2/modxslt.c - moved unsetting Content-Length a couple lines further in the code, and added checks for the environment variable 'no-xslt'. This should allow for more flexible usage of mod-xslt (see thread in ml, from a couple months ago).

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: I wasn't sure if we wanted to have this, as mod-xslt already has *lot* (too many?) mechanisms to enable / disable it on a per document basis. However, SetEnvIf seems to be common practice, by grepping into standard apache modules.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: I'm still unsure :) so, if you have any opinion, let me know, and we'll work something out (or just revert this change).

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: In any case, thanks to <colin at bendell.ca> for providing the patch and raising the issue.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: lib/modxslt-debug.c - corrected dumb bug in flags parsing code, and removed a couple warnings.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache1/modxslt.c - added configuration file options to set and modify enhanched debug options.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache2/modxslt-helpers.c - error handler now caches results and doesn't actually output errors until a \n is outputted by libxslt. This should really improve quality of debug output.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache2/modxslt.c - added configuration file options to set and modify enhanched debug options.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache2/modxslt.h - added variable in mxslt_ap2_debug_buffer_t, to keep note of data in the buffer.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: utils/modxslt-parse.c - improved error output generation.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache2/Makefile.in - corrected dumb bug in 'uninstall' target, that broke unistalling mod-xslt2 harder than needed.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: lib/modxslt-doc.c - previous CL was not enough. And it seems like I'm a moron. Haven't worked on this code for too long, it seems.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: lib/modxslt-doc.c - fixed bug in local:// handling that seldom caused segmentation faults and wrong behaviors.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc/faq/faq.xml - updated, to clarify description of local://.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc/faq/xslt/faq-fo.xsl - the world has changed, the .xsl was making recent versions of fop and xsltproc unhappy. Updated the stylesheet.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc/faq/xslt/faq-html.xsl - same as above.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc/faq/* - regenerated all the output files.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: {arch}/=tagging-method - now ignoring ID files generated by GNU id-utils.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: lib/modxslt-debug.c - added functions for parsing debug strings.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: lib/modxslt0/modxslt-debug.h - removed obsolete macro, added doxygen comments, definitions of new functions, and cleaned up a bit debugging flags.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: lib/modxslt0/modxslt-macro.h - str_size and array_size redefined as mxslt_sizeof_array and mxslt_sizeof_str, to avoid conflicts with other header files.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: lib/modxslt-libxml.c - updated to use new macro names defined above.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: lib/modxslt-doc.c - as above.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache1/modxslt.c - as above.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: */Makefile.in - added datarootdir=@datarootdir@ to avoid warnings during the configure process regarding missing datarootdir.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: ChangeLog - added a ChangeLog file generated directly by TLA with all revisions.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: */Makefile.in - modified to infer --tag parameter for libtool explicitly. This should fix a long lasting bug with newer autoconf versions.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache1/modxslt-helpers.c - added a simple TODO note.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache2/modxslt.c - modified to compile with apache 2.2.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: aclocal.m4 - updated with more recent autoconf tools.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: configure - generated ex-novo.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: tools/ - removed some obsolete and now meaningless files.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: configure.ac - modified to allow name changes in apr-x libraries .. hope this will actually improve things and not worsen them.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: * - MXSLT_DO_DEBUG macro has been removed, in order to allow configuring _run time_ debugging level, to ease the task of finding problems.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: lib/modxslt0/modxslt.h - mxslt_doc_t now uses forward references and typedefs in a saner way.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: lib/modxslt0/modxslt.h - mxslt_doc_init has been changed to allow setting up debugging callbacks.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: lib/modxslt0/modxslt.h - MXSLT_DEBUG macro has been deeply changed and modified.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: lib/modxslt-doc.c - removed mxslt_doc_rec_free, which seems buggy and unused.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: * - removed all references to all macros MXSLT_DEBUG. They all have been replaced by mxslt_debug_print and mxslt_debug_write.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache1/modxslt-ap1.h - renamed to modxslt.h

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: lib/modxslt0/ - many header files have been renamed and split up in multiple files.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache1/ - the dynamic handler now parses both text/xml and application/xml.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache2/ - slight cleanup took place... removed tons of obsolete code.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: lib/modxslt-opr-cmp.c - regular expression escaping code had not been updated to match new escaping rules. A potential bug in previous mod-xslt versions has also been solved. Thanks again to Eric Anderso, <ejona86 at gmail.com>. I now believe I own him a beer.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: tools/* - corrected dumb script in release scripts ...

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: tools/ - corrected a few errors in the release scripts

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc/ - generated ex-novo...

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc/manual.xml - note tag requires para inside.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: tools/library/ - corrected minor bugs introduced with added support for Update scripts ...

release.update: A lot of minor bugs were corrected. Update if something you need is not working, but watch out: the escaping rules of mod-xslt expressions have changed. Your media expressions in document that were already working under mod-xslt may not work anymore! Take a look to the manual note "Since mod-xslt2 1.3.9", in section "Choosing the stylesheet to use / xml-stylesheet and modxslt-stylesheet / Media Expressions / Strings".

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: tools/* - corrected dumb script in release scripts ...

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: tools/ - corrected a few errors in the release scripts

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc/ - generated ex-novo...

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc/manual.xml - note tag requires para inside.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: tools/library/ - corrected minor bugs introduced with added support for Update scripts ...

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: lib/modxslt-libxml.c - the exslt ``document'' extension href attribute now uses the path of the current .xml file to calculate relative urls.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: lib/modxslt-doc.c - now tries to look for the media type in imported documents .. this should solve many of the media-type issues, but still ignore many other parameters of the xsl:output parameter.. let's see how it works... seems like libxslt does not perform any xsl:output merging. Current code walks list of imported documents...

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: lib/* - finally, removed IS_BLANK warning .. its name was clashing with one of libxml2 macros...

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache2 - the code now respects strict aliasing rules, and no more type-punned warnings are issued by gcc...

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: lib/parser/* - corrected a few bugs introduced with previous commit

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc/faq.xml - added references to xsl:output problem, where media-type is ignored from imported documents. Thanks to <latypoff at yandex.ru> for reporting this problem.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: lib/modxslt-opr-cmp.c - corrected minor bug that caused wrong error message in case the regular expression was not correct. Thanks to Eric Anderson <ejona86 at gmail.com> for reporting this problem.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc/manual/ - better explained XSLTParam,

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: lib/modxslt-doc.c - mxslt_http_open was not correctly checking for local handlers, causing a segfault under some conditions.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: lib/modxslt-doc.c - mxslt_local_open did not calculate local:// urls correctly when no open method was provided. Thanks to Richar Leopold <mod-xslt2-users at leo.0n3.org> and Eric Anderson <ejona86 at gmail.com> for reporting this problem.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc/manual/ - added a few notes about AddOutputFilterByType...

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: tools/ - added support for Update files, so update information need not to be inputted manually at release or snapshot time, allowing them to be written time by time...

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: lib/parser/modxslt-screen-expr.lex - modified in order to change and improve escaping rules...

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc/manual.xml - some examples were split over multiple lines, to ease the task of reading them.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc/manual.xml - corrected a few types here and there, and generally added some useful notes here and there.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc/faq.xml - added a few questions regarding XSLTSetStylesheet and XSLTDefaultStylesheet.

release.update: Minor changes in Makefiles. mod-xslt should now be easier to install for non root users, and apache2 sapi should be install again (in previous snapshot, I forgot a -d parameter in one of the Makefiles.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache2/Makefile.in - in previous commit, forgot a -d parameter. Thanks to <pacifico at drizzle.com> for pointing that out.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache2/Makefile.in - checks for UID == 0 have now been changed in checks for writeability of destination directory.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc/credits.xml - added kudos to Peter Svanber for providing updated patches for libxml and libxslt.

release.update: This version of mod-xslt fixes many portability problems, mainly in Makefiles and configure scripts. No other changes have been introduced yet, but minor bug fixes. If an older version of mod-xslt is working for you, there is no need to upgrade.

This version of mod-xslt fixes many portability problems, mainly in Makefiles and configure scripts. No other changes have been introduced yet, but minor bug fixes. If older version of mod-xslt is working for you, there is no need to upgrade.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: configure, configure.ac - updated automatically by release scripts, in order to prepare a snapshot.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc/faq/faq.xml - updated to include information about MXSLT_DISABLE_SIGNATURE.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: Makefile.in - removed all -D, -g, -o, --mode, --owner, --group usage from every install call.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: Makefile.in - are now all calling $(INSTALL) instead of install.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: */Makefile.in - some makefiles where incorrectly referencing ``install'' directly, instead of using the $(INSTALL) configure calculated variable. Some Makefiles also use non-standard -D install option. Hope configure will point the $(INSTALL) to the correct location, otherwise that would need to be fixed too.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: patches/libxml-2.6.16 - added patches from Peter Svanberg. His original patch has been splitted into two files, like for other libxml versions. It should still work without problems.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache2 - under apache2, mod-xslt was ``prepending'' its name to that of apache. ap_append.*version was called too early, while it should have been called in the post config hook. Thanks to <a.ledvinka at promon.cz>

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: - getting ready for starting to work on the 1.4.0 brench of modxslt. The current brench has been renamed into modxslt2--main--1.3, to make it clear what the development line refers to...

release.update: Completely backward compatible with previous snapshots. Fixes just release and snapshots scripts used by developers.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: configure, configure.ac - updated automatically by release scripts, in order to prepare a snapshot.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: tools/ - few more bugs corrected in release and snapshot scripts.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: configure - regenerated

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: tools/ - snapshot script was not correctly comparing versions, and did not update configure correctly

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: tools/ - updated release & snapshot scripts, they now seems to work correcty

release.update: Should be backward compatible. Many portability bugs have been corrected. XSLTSetStylesheet was wrongly described in the manual. Added some new configuration parameters.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache2/modxslt-helpers.c - in some cases, a failed load for a given stylesheet caused a segfault. Added handling for MXSLT_SKIP return value.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: tools/ - rewritten all scripts used to release, snapshot and upload mod-xslt. Should be much easyer to use, less error-prone and should generate a Changes file in the main directory.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: utils/Makefile.in - was still generating wrong modxslt-config files. Seems like the grep trick didn't work at all. It felt strange an undocumented feature like that. Now, it has been replaced with a more sane minded sed expression, based on addresses.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc/manual - recompiled one more time.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache2/modxslt.c - added XSLTDelRule parameter support in apache2.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc/manual/manual.xml - updated to include documentation about XSLTAddRule and XSLTDelRule.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc/manual/ - recompiled, to have all formats updated.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache1 - added the XSLTDelRule parameter, to remove a rule previously set.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: TODO - updated, to include the If-Modified header handling I had all forgot about.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache2 - added support for XSLTDefaultStylesheet parameter and XSLTNoDefaultStylesheet.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache1 - estetic changes to list of apache parameters

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache2/modxslt.c - mxslt_ap2_out_filter was not returning APR_SUCCESS

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc/manual/manual.xml - same changes as for apache1 sapi: corrected XSLTSetStylesheet/XSLTUnSetStylesheet parameters and added XSLTDefaultStylesheet/XSLTNoDefaultStylesheet

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc/manual - recompiled, to have all formats

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: utils/Makefile.in - previous commit didn't solve the problem, blame me. Should always check before committing.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: utils/Makefile.in - previous commit that solved compatibility issue with freebsd sed introduced a small bug. Corrected now.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache1/modxslt-helpers.c - in previous commit was not checking if defaultstyle was NULL, potentially causing a segfault.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache1 - Added directive XSLTDefaultStylesheet, to allow users to provide a default stylesheet in case none can be found, and XSLTNoDefaultStylesheet, to disable a previously defined default stylesheet.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc/manual/manual.xml - added new configuration parameters XSLTDefaultStylesheet and XSLTNoDefaultStylesheet to the manual.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc/manual/manual.xml - XSLTSetStylesheet were erroneously described as providing those features now provided by XSLTDefaultStylesheet/XSLTNoDefaultStylesheet. Thanks to Adam Souzis.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc/manual/ - recompiled for all provided formats.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: utils/Makefile.in - sed expression was not correctly working on FreeBSD. Changed with a grep based expression, couresy of Squeeeez. Thanks to Ryan Moe for reporting the problem.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache2/modxslt-helpers.c - ap_table_elts instead apr_table_elts. Thanks to <giskard at autistici.org>, Dave Carrigan and Adam Souizs.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: configure.ac - now looks into /usr/sbin for apxs. Thanks to Adam Souzis for reporting problems with Gentoo linux.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache1/ - Makefile was uncorrectly compiling apache module against static version of modxslt library, leading to problems on some architectures like hppa and ia64.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc/ - updated as suggested on sourceforge. Main idea is to better document LoadModule parameter and given examples.

release.update: Should be backward compatible without problems. Minor changes in the API & ABI. Whatch out for the Content-Lenght header handling and chunked encoding, which slightly changed.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc/faq - added entries for libxslt bug

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: tools - improved release tools

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc/manual - recompiled manual

release.update: Should be backward compatible. Only some minor changes. Whatch out for problems with the keep-alive handling (changed handling of Content-Lenght header)

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache*/ - Content-Length header is now unset to try to avoid keepalive problems.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc/manual/manual.xml - corrected dumb typo in manual.xml. Is anybody actually reading the site? Why didn't anybody tell me about the error :>? Let's hide some typos around. Can you find them :? (winner will be cited in the credits)

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: - improved release handling scripts

release.update: Many bug fixes, intrduces API incompatible changes in the library. Added support for rules in apache configuration files. Take a look to the manual.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: lib/parser/*.lex - now handles a conditional parameter which allows flags to be passed to the lex scanner

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: lib/modxslt0/modxslt.h - some prototypes changed accordingly

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: lib/parser/modxslt-scree-expr.y - after previous change, was not correclty handling errors anymore.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache1 - added more debugging output.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache* - url of the stylesheet specified with XSLTAddRule is evaluated to replace variables.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc/manual/manual.xml - updated to include examples of XSLT parameters usage, included XSLTAddRule.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc/faq/faq.xml - updated to explain difference between XSLTAddForce and XSLTAddFilter.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: - removed many obsolete #if 0 comments

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: lib/mxslt_doc_parse_pi - first API and ABI library interface change. style parameter was not used and completely ignored. Removed it from argument list.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: lib/mxslt_doc_parse_pi - does not try to load an external stylesheet any longer if a stylesheet has already been provided by the caller.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: lib/mxslt_doc_parse_pi - caller relied on this function to load any provided stylesheet before attempting to parse pi, but style parameter was completely ignored. XSLTSetStylesheet parameter was thus not working at all, since the change was first introduced. Now, the logic has been moved in the caller.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache1 - added support for XSLTAddRule parameter.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: lib/parser/modxslt-scree-expr.y - now allows modxslt expressions to be made withut any leading screen and or ``any and ...''. Also, generated .c and .h files ex-novo.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc/api/api.xml - started to document libmodxslt0 API and to cleanup its code. I expect the major number to be changed in a couple snapshots. I still consider the API kind of beta, so I'm not worring too much about introducing API/ABI changes. I'm not aware of any external software using this library. If you are, please let me know. I would then start to behave as a good & nice kid.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache1 - updated to conform to new libmodxslt0 API.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache2 - updated to conform to new libmodxslt0 API.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc/manual/manual.xml - updated to include new apache 1/2 parameter.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: Makefile.in, configure.ac, doc/man/Makefile.in - updated to install manual pages

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: - modified some toplevel readme files to reflect the recently introduced changes.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: lib/ - now `options' are passed over to most of libxml functions. This may introduce backward incompatibilities, since options are no longer left to default values, but should better handle DTD and stuff like that.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: - now, dicts are passed over whenever a stylesheet gets parsed.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: lib/modxslt-doc.c - was missing some cpp directives to support xinclude

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache2/Makefile.in - added -D parameter to install. Should solve an error regarding libtool complaining about wrong installation directory.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: lib/modxslt-doc.c - added variables for xinclude support, incremented interface version. Added calls to xmlXIncludeProcess, to process xmlInclude directives.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: configure.ac - added parameter --disable-xinclude.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: lib/modxslt-doc.c - Content-Encoding header was erroneously set to the document charset. This violated rfc 2616. I suspect this is the error that caused problems to GPRS users who reported problems accessing sites made with modxslt. Many GPRS providers use data compressors (such as nettgain), that rely on the above header being correctly set. Internet Explorer users were receiving compressed data as plain/html, getting nice symbols on their own screen.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc/man - added manual pages for modxslt commands.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc/manual/Makefile - manual directory is not removed any longer, in order to preserve tla ids.

release.update: Should update. Fixes some bugs in apache 1.3 SAPI and apache 2.0 cacheing. Parameters handling (XSLTParam) behavior has changed, due to bugs being corrected. If your code relied on those bugs, the update may be backward incompatible.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: configure.ac - updated version number

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc - recompiled

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache2 - minor changes to Makefile.in

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: - main purpose of the commit is to verify the new tla archive works correctly

release.update: Major changes. Corrected bugs in handling configuration parameters. If your setups relyad on those bugs to work, they won't work anymore. Beshide that, should be backward compatible.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache2 - quick hack to disable cacheing of pages, uses f->r->no_local_copy, thx to <daniel dot eckl at gmx dot net>, even if he doesn't know.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: makefiles - removed references to NDEBUG. Now assertions are compiled in by default even in non debugging versions.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: lib/modxslt-doc.c - some variables could have been used uninitialized... error introduced in previous commit.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache* - reverted to ap_overlay_tables. Merging two tables correctly uses a quadratic algorithm, while catenating them is much faster. However, ap_overlay_tables usage has been corrected in order to make parameters work correctly.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache2/Makefile.in - corrected error in dependencies. Caused library to be recompiled under certain conditions and missused the VPATH parameter.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache* - removed calls to ap_overlay_table, replaced with mxslt_ap_merge_tables. Parameters were not correctly merged when abusing of hierarchical relationships to setup xslt parameters. Updated headers accordingly.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache1 - I received a bug report regarding mod-xslt returning raw .xml under apache1 under heavy load. Couldn't reproduce the problem, but seems like a locking issues. The only global which may cause the problem I can think of is mxslt_global_skip_fixup, which, however, is per process and not shared. Added some assertions to verify the correctness of its value anyway, and now fixup handlers are skipped at most once using that variable.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache1 - when using local:// urls, if no temporary directory was defined with XSLTTmpDir, the request failed.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc/faq.xml - updated adding all the new questions that came out on the mailing list. Thanks to all the subscribers!!

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: lib/modxslt-doc.c - local:// relative urls were not correctly handled under certain conditions.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: lib/modxslt-doc.c - debugging output in mxlst_load_stylesheet could cause segmentation fault, since a complex structure was printed as a string.

release.update: Should update if you want to use apache2 worker mpm. No other changes. Needs some testing.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache2 - ap2_child_init was called by apache2 only when the process forked. The worker mpm forks the process, but each fork runs its own set of threads. However, I need to prepare tsd in every single thread.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache2 - calling ap2_child_init for each thread posed problems in deallocating memory. Memory is now no longer allocated from the server pool, which seems to be shared among threads, but in its own memory area.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: tools - minor changes in upload scripts, corrected some minor bugs

release.update: Should update only if using apache2 sapi. No new features have been introduced. Documentation has been sorted out.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc - adjusted documentation layout

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: tools - adding scripts to automatically release mod-xslt2

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache2 - configurations were fetched using wrongly - caused segfault during apache2 load.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: configure - seems like the last time I generated it using the wrong version of autoconf

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache2 - table dumping routine was not working and causing segfaults.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc/faq - added xslt stylesheet to generate faq.fo and faq.pdf. Many thanks go to <mmerlin at masobit.net>

release.update: Should update. It is backward compatible, and fixes some bugs in the apache1 sapi. apache2 sapi is now working and documented. No new features have been introduced.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc/manual - updated apache2 documentation

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: README - updated

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: configure.ac - updated to point to new documentation files

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache2 - wrong brigade was passed over to parser, causing only the last brigade of multiple brigades pages to be parsed. This caused problems to php.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache2 - mxslt_ap2_file_parse was still checking for MXSLT_SKIP after mxslt_doc_parse_pi, which does not exist anymore.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache2 - handling of redirects and non 200 statuses now works correctly.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache2 - still have problems with php4 compiled as a handler if the output is not valid xml: php closes the connection instead of sending the correct page for the status (500) returned by mod-xslt. Is this my problem or php's? According to php-4.3.8/sapi/apache2handler/ sapi_apache2.c and subsequent lines, I don't have many chances to fix this... unless I take care ov everything... what about apache2 compiled as a filter? How does it work?

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: lib/modxslt0/modxslt.h - well, it's been a long time since last change in the library... here, I just undef some constants so apache2 code doesn't complain about variables being redefined.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache1/Makefile - Added quotes around install and clean directory. Do they have any use? does it really work with directories containing ' 's?

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache2/Makefile - Makefile clean target now works correctly (it is using the libtool --clean as it should have done).

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache2/Makefile - Updated to use new library version and to actually get a compiled version of the module.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache2 - now it really compiles cleanly. Corrected some dumb errors, API updates and so on...

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: lib/modxslt0/modxslt.h - added a couple prototypes for functions I believe I never wrote but are in my own source files.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache2 - nconf->params was not initialized at all, causing a segfault.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache1/ - buffers were not correctly updated after subrequests. This leaded to other apache components to think that either data was still available to be read in the buffer or to wait for the client to send more data.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache1/ - in case a ``strange'' status (!= HTTP_OK) was returned by the sub request handler, apache was calling a function (ap_die?) to discard the body of the request. This combined with the error above, caused correct behavior for each request that filled a single buffer (< 4k), since the buffer was left where it was (even if data was already read) and ap_die had the chance to correctly discard the body.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: - the two above corrections fixed a long standing bug with post requests and KeepAlive handling. Many thanks go to Andrea Ciancone, who provided a test case that blocked apache on each request.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: Makefile.in - the Makefile was incorrectly trying to compile/tidy documentation, even if it is already included in the package.

release.update: Should update. It is backward compatible, and fixes some bad problems and some minor problems. No new features have been introduced.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: Archived moved to GNU Arch (tla). No more CVS.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: Documentation has been cleaned up, sorted, and included in the tarball

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: Now, documentation is available in _many_ formats

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: Makefiles have been adjusted and cleaned up

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: libtool has been updated, and its script have been synced with this latest version. This should solve the missing .so extension problem. Thanks to Scott Jame Remnant, who helped me a lot even if he doesn't know :)

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: Makefiles now honor the DESTDIR environment variable. There is no mnore --prefix hack.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache1 - sometimes temporary file did not get removed. This was due to mxslt_ap1_merge_dir_config that did not merge the configuration for the unlink variable.

release.update: Third public release. Should update. Minor bug corrected in handling apache 1.3 requests.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: Corrected bug in handling redirects (sapi apache1). Small redirects weren't correctly flushed, leaving the request in an undefined state.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: Now, the apache2 code compiles again. However, I wouldn't recomend it for _any_ use. Deadlock detection code was cut out. I don't have the time to finish it right now.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: Cleaned up documentation a bit.

release.update: Second public release. No need to update. No bugs corrected, no new features introduced.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: Corrected clean target in utils Makefile.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: Few updates to the apache2 codebase. Still need to complete few functions before it will be usable again under apache2.

release.update: First public release. Update from any previous version. Should be backward compatible with itself.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: Corrected dumb NULL pointer dereference in loop handling code.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: Corrected dumb NULL pointer dereference in variable substitution code.

release.update: For beta testers only. Not backward compatible.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: New loop detection code based on virtual hosts, remote and local URLs.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: Corrected error management code. Updated so each message outputs a terminating '\n'.

release.update: For beta testers only. Not backward compatible.
For beta testers only. Not backward compatible.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: Updated configure script. It now builds the library and the SAPI.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: Directory structure completely modified. There is now complete separation between the SAPI and the mod-xslt library. Everything has been updated to use libtool.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: Completely rewrote the bison parser.

entry.log: Better handling of libxml incompatibilities in configure

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: Now parses variables and local:// urls

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: FAQ has been updated

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: Parameters are now completely handled using internal hashing tables

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: Rewrote parser Makefile

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: Many updates in bison grammar

release.update: For beta testers only. Not backward compatible.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: Cleaned up table handling headers

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: Better memory management in routines handling mod-xslt grammar

release.update: First release of new mod-xslt code, after the whole rewrite. For beta testers only. It is not backward compatible.
Should be backward compatible. Many portability bugs have been corrected. XSLTSetStylesheet was wrongly described in the manual. Added some new configuration parameters.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: configure, configure.ac - updated automatically by release scripts, in order to prepare a snapshot.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: tools/ - few more bugs corrected in release and snapshot scripts.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: configure - regenerated

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: tools/ - snapshot script was not correctly comparing versions, and did not update configure correctly

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: tools/ - updated release & snapshot scripts, they now seems to work correcty

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache2/modxslt-helpers.c - in some cases, a failed load for a given stylesheet caused a segfault. Added handling for MXSLT_SKIP return value.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: tools/ - rewritten all scripts used to release, snapshot and upload mod-xslt. Should be much easyer to use, less error-prone and should generate a Changes file in the main directory.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: utils/Makefile.in - was still generating wrong modxslt-config files. Seems like the grep trick didn't work at all. It felt strange an undocumented feature like that. Now, it has been replaced with a more sane minded sed expression, based on addresses.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc/manual - recompiled one more time.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache2/modxslt.c - added XSLTDelRule parameter support in apache2.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc/manual/manual.xml - updated to include documentation about XSLTAddRule and XSLTDelRule.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc/manual/ - recompiled, to have all formats updated.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache1 - added the XSLTDelRule parameter, to remove a rule previously set.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: TODO - updated, to include the If-Modified header handling I had all forgot about.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache2 - added support for XSLTDefaultStylesheet parameter and XSLTNoDefaultStylesheet.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache1 - estetic changes to list of apache parameters

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache2/modxslt.c - mxslt_ap2_out_filter was not returning APR_SUCCESS

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc/manual/manual.xml - same changes as for apache1 sapi: corrected XSLTSetStylesheet/XSLTUnSetStylesheet parameters and added XSLTDefaultStylesheet/XSLTNoDefaultStylesheet

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc/manual - recompiled, to have all formats

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: utils/Makefile.in - previous commit didn't solve the problem, blame me. Should always check before committing.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: utils/Makefile.in - previous commit that solved compatibility issue with freebsd sed introduced a small bug. Corrected now.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache1/modxslt-helpers.c - in previous commit was not checking if defaultstyle was NULL, potentially causing a segfault.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache1 - Added directive XSLTDefaultStylesheet, to allow users to provide a default stylesheet in case none can be found, and XSLTNoDefaultStylesheet, to disable a previously defined default stylesheet.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc/manual/manual.xml - added new configuration parameters XSLTDefaultStylesheet and XSLTNoDefaultStylesheet to the manual.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc/manual/manual.xml - XSLTSetStylesheet were erroneously described as providing those features now provided by XSLTDefaultStylesheet/XSLTNoDefaultStylesheet. Thanks to Adam Souzis.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc/manual/ - recompiled for all provided formats.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: utils/Makefile.in - sed expression was not correctly working on FreeBSD. Changed with a grep based expression, couresy of Squeeeez. Thanks to Ryan Moe for reporting the problem.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache2/modxslt-helpers.c - ap_table_elts instead apr_table_elts. Thanks to <giskard at autistici.org>, Dave Carrigan and Adam Souizs.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: configure.ac - now looks into /usr/sbin for apxs. Thanks to Adam Souzis for reporting problems with Gentoo linux.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache1/ - Makefile was uncorrectly compiling apache module against static version of modxslt library, leading to problems on some architectures like hppa and ia64.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc/ - updated as suggested on sourceforge. Main idea is to better document LoadModule parameter and given examples.

release.update: Should be backward compatible without problems. Minor changes in the API & ABI. Whatch out for the Content-Lenght header handling and chunked encoding, which slightly changed.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc/faq - added entries for libxslt bug

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: tools - improved release tools

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc/manual - recompiled manual

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache*/ - Content-Length header is now unset to try to avoid keepalive problems.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc/manual/manual.xml - corrected dumb typo in manual.xml. Is anybody actually reading the site? Why didn't anybody tell me about the error :>? Let's hide some typos around. Can you find them :? (winner will be cited in the credits)

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: - improved release handling scripts

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: lib/parser/*.lex - now handles a conditional parameter which allows flags to be passed to the lex scanner

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: lib/modxslt0/modxslt.h - some prototypes changed accordingly

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: lib/parser/modxslt-scree-expr.y - after previous change, was not correclty handling errors anymore.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache1 - added more debugging output.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache* - url of the stylesheet specified with XSLTAddRule is evaluated to replace variables.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc/manual/manual.xml - updated to include examples of XSLT parameters usage, included XSLTAddRule.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc/faq/faq.xml - updated to explain difference between XSLTAddForce and XSLTAddFilter.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: - removed many obsolete #if 0 comments

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: lib/mxslt_doc_parse_pi - first API and ABI library interface change. style parameter was not used and completely ignored. Removed it from argument list.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: lib/mxslt_doc_parse_pi - does not try to load an external stylesheet any longer if a stylesheet has already been provided by the caller.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: lib/mxslt_doc_parse_pi - caller relied on this function to load any provided stylesheet before attempting to parse pi, but style parameter was completely ignored. XSLTSetStylesheet parameter was thus not working at all, since the change was first introduced. Now, the logic has been moved in the caller.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache1 - added support for XSLTAddRule parameter.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: lib/parser/modxslt-scree-expr.y - now allows modxslt expressions to be made withut any leading screen and or ``any and ...''. Also, generated .c and .h files ex-novo.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc/api/api.xml - started to document libmodxslt0 API and to cleanup its code. I expect the major number to be changed in a couple snapshots. I still consider the API kind of beta, so I'm not worring too much about introducing API/ABI changes. I'm not aware of any external software using this library. If you are, please let me know. I would then start to behave as a good & nice kid.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache1 - updated to conform to new libmodxslt0 API.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache2 - updated to conform to new libmodxslt0 API.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc/manual/manual.xml - updated to include new apache 1/2 parameter.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: Makefile.in, configure.ac, doc/man/Makefile.in - updated to install manual pages

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: - modified some toplevel readme files to reflect the recently introduced changes.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: lib/ - now `options' are passed over to most of libxml functions. This may introduce backward incompatibilities, since options are no longer left to default values, but should better handle DTD and stuff like that.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: - now, dicts are passed over whenever a stylesheet gets parsed.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: lib/modxslt-doc.c - was missing some cpp directives to support xinclude

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache2/Makefile.in - added -D parameter to install. Should solve an error regarding libtool complaining about wrong installation directory.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: lib/modxslt-doc.c - added variables for xinclude support, incremented interface version. Added calls to xmlXIncludeProcess, to process xmlInclude directives.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: configure.ac - added parameter --disable-xinclude.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: lib/modxslt-doc.c - Content-Encoding header was erroneously set to the document charset. This violated rfc 2616. I suspect this is the error that caused problems to GPRS users who reported problems accessing sites made with modxslt. Many GPRS providers use data compressors (such as nettgain), that rely on the above header being correctly set. Internet Explorer users were receiving compressed data as plain/html, getting nice symbols on their own screen.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc/man - added manual pages for modxslt commands.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc/manual/Makefile - manual directory is not removed any longer, in order to preserve tla ids.

release.update: Should update. Fixes some bugs in apache 1.3 SAPI and apache 2.0 cacheing. Parameters handling (XSLTParam) behavior has changed, due to bugs being corrected. If your code relied on those bugs, the update may be backward incompatible.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: configure.ac - updated version number

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc - recompiled

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache2 - minor changes to Makefile.in

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: - main purpose of the commit is to verify the new tla archive works correctly

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache2 - quick hack to disable cacheing of pages, uses f->r->no_local_copy, thx to <daniel dot eckl at gmx dot net>, even if he doesn't know.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: makefiles - removed references to NDEBUG. Now assertions are compiled in by default even in non debugging versions.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: lib/modxslt-doc.c - some variables could have been used uninitialized... error introduced in previous commit.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache* - reverted to ap_overlay_tables. Merging two tables correctly uses a quadratic algorithm, while catenating them is much faster. However, ap_overlay_tables usage has been corrected in order to make parameters work correctly.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache2/Makefile.in - corrected error in dependencies. Caused library to be recompiled under certain conditions and missused the VPATH parameter.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache* - removed calls to ap_overlay_table, replaced with mxslt_ap_merge_tables. Parameters were not correctly merged when abusing of hierarchical relationships to setup xslt parameters. Updated headers accordingly.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache1 - I received a bug report regarding mod-xslt returning raw .xml under apache1 under heavy load. Couldn't reproduce the problem, but seems like a locking issues. The only global which may cause the problem I can think of is mxslt_global_skip_fixup, which, however, is per process and not shared. Added some assertions to verify the correctness of its value anyway, and now fixup handlers are skipped at most once using that variable.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: sapi/apache1 - when using local:// urls, if no temporary directory was defined with XSLTTmpDir, the request failed.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: doc/faq.xml - updated adding all the new questions that came out on the mailing list. Thanks to all the subscribers!!

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: lib/modxslt-doc.c - local:// relative urls were not correctly handled under certain conditions.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: lib/modxslt-doc.c - debugging output in mxlst_load_stylesheet could cause segmentation fault, since a complex structure was printed as a string.

release.update: Should update only if using apache2 sapi. No new features have been introduced. Documentation has been sorted out.

entry.log: sapi/apache1/ - in case a ``strange'' status (!= HTTP_OK) was returned by the sub request handler, apache was calling a function (ap_die?) to discard the body of the request. This combined with the error above, caused correct behavior for each request that filled a single buffer (< 4k), since the buffer was left where it was (even if data was already read) and ap_die had the chance to correctly discard the body.

entry.log: Corrected bug in handling redirects (sapi apache1). Small redirects weren't correctly flushed, leaving the request in an undefined state.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: Now, the apache2 code compiles again. However, I wouldn't recomend it for _any_ use. Deadlock detection code was cut out. I don't have the time to finish it right now.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: Cleaned up documentation a bit.

release.update: Second public release. No need to update. No bugs corrected, no new features introduced.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: Corrected clean target in utils Makefile.

entry.author: ccontavalli
entry.log: Few updates to the apache2 codebase. Still need to complete few functions before it will be usable again under apache2.

release.update: First public release. Update from any previous version. Should be backward compatible with itself.

entry.log: Corrected dumb NULL pointer dereference in loop handling code.

entry.log: First public release of new mod-xslt codebase.
